intro: Monnina resedoides, commonly known as scarlet globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial that typically grows in dry, sandy soils. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of red, pink, or purple. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. The genus Monnina is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus.
